news.headline: Accenture cuts annual revenue forecast
news.summary: IT services provider Accenture cut its fiscal-year 2024 revenue forecast on Thursday, as an uncertain economy prompts clients to cut spending on its consulting services.  The company now expects revenue growth in the range of 1% to 3%, from its prior forecast of 2% to 5%.

news.headline: Accenture fans IT industry spending gloom with annual forecast cut
news.summary: Accenture now expects full-year revenue growth in the range of 1% to 3%, from its prior forecast of 2% to 5%.  The firm has been grappling with sluggish demand for its IT and consulting services as high interest rates slam the brakes on an industry that benefited from breakneck growth during the pandemic.  That has led the company to lay off employees, with Accenture set to book $450 million in severance-related costs this fiscal year after recording $1.1 billion the previous year when it said it would cut around 19,000 jobs, or 2.5% of its workforce.

news.headline: UPDATE 1-Accenture cuts its annual revenue forecast
news.summary: IT services provider Accenture cut its fiscal-year 2024 revenue forecast on Thursday, as an uncertain economy prompts clients to cut spending on its consulting services.  Accenture now expects full-year revenue growth in the range of 1% to 3%, from its prior forecast of 2% to 5%.  The firm has been grappling with sluggish demand for its IT and consulting services as high interest rates and an uncertain economic outlook prompt clients to withhold expenditure.

news.headline: Accenture Beats Earnings Estimates. Why the Stock Is Falling.
news.summary: Shares of  Accenture  were trading lower after the management consultant and tech company topped earnings estimates but issued weak guidance.  For its fiscal second quarter ended Feb. 29, Accenture posted adjusted per-share earnings of $2.77, beating Wall Street’s call for $2.66, according to FactSet.  Revenue of $15.8 billion was slightly below the consensus estimate of $15.85 billion, and new bookings were $21.58 billion, falling 2% from the year-ago period.

news.headline: Accenture stock dips on slashed full-year outlook
news.summary: Shares of Accenture (ACN) are trading lower Thursday morning following the company's decision to cut its full-year revenue forecast. The move comes on the heels of Accenture reporting mixed second quarter earnings results. While the company missed analyst estimates for revenue, coming in at $15.8 billion against expectations of $15.82 billion, it surpassed adjusted earnings per share (EPS) expectations. Yahoo Finance's Seana Smith and Brad Smith break down the details. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Editor's note: This article was written by Angel Smith

news.headline: Indian IT stocks tumble as Accenture "pours water" on hopes of rebound in demand
news.summary: Shares of Indian IT services firm tumbled more than 3% on Friday, a day after Accenture cut its fiscal 2024 revenue forecast, dashing hopes of a rebound in demand recovery.  The Nifty IT index fell 3.2%, with industry bellwethers Infosys and Tata Consultancy Services declining 3.5% and 2.7%, respectively.  The duo had posted better-than-feared quarterly results in January, sparking hopes of a revival in demand from banking, financial services and insurance clients, especially in the U.S. key market, after over of a year of clients cutting budgets and delaying, or even cancelling, contracts.

news.headline: Insider Q&A: Nellie Borrero recounts 4 decades of addressing racism and bringing change to Accenture
news.summary: It didn't take long for Nellie Borrero to encounter racism in 1986 when she joined a major consulting firm that was the predecessor to Accenture.  The next Monday, Borrero confronted the partner to explain she felt humiliated and felt she didn't belong at the company.  The partner, Borrero says, expressed remorse and promised to help her change the company's culture if she stayed.
